name: The Root
summary: Using a "/" followed by a name will execute a program with that name from the root directory.

name: Program and absolute paths
summary: The "/" can be used to enter a directory and find files within said directory.

name: Position yet elsewhere
summary: Use cd to change directories (for the third time).

name: implicit relative paths, from /
summary: Specifying a sub-directory name followed by a slash will resolve the file name based on the current directory.

name: explicit relative paths, from /
summary: Starting a command with a "./" will resolve file names and sub-directories based on the current directory.

name: implicit relative path
summary: Files and executables within the same directory can be executed with "./" followed by the file name, without needing to go to a different directory.

name: home sweet home
summary: The leading tilde "~" refers to the home directory; such paths are considered absolute.
